channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Texas abortion: Biden vows 'whole-of-government' response to new law
item.description: The president called the decision not to block the law an "unprecedented assault" on women's rights.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: Millions at risk under aid blockade - UN
item.description: "The world's worst famine situation in decades" is brewing in the north of the country, the UN says.

item.title: China's media cracks down on 'effeminate' styles
item.description: The media regulator says it will shun "vulgar influencers" while casting a spotlight on stars' pay.

item.title: Abba delight fans with new 10-song album and virtual concert
item.description: The Swedish pop legends reunite to record 10 new songs for their first studio album for 40 years.

item.title: Climate-above-all plea by US fails to stir China
item.description: Envoy John Kerry's 'it's more important than politics' appeal falls on deaf ears.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Anger after Paralympian is stripped of gold medal for being late
item.description: Muhammad Ziyad Zolkefli won his shot put event but had his title revoked because he was three minutes late.

item.title: Yves de M'Bella: Ivory Coast TV host sentenced for promoting rape
item.description: A guest was asked to simulate a sexual assault using a mannequin live on Ivory Coast TV.

item.title: China linked to takeover of Italian drone plant
item.description: Six people are reported to prosecutors over the takeover which police say broke arms laws.

item.title: Pedro Almodovar's 'irresistible' Parallel Mothers opens Venice Film Festival
item.description: The movie stars Penelope Cruz as one of two women who meet in hospital just before they give birth.

item.title: Panjshir - the valley trying to hold off the Taliban
item.description: The last bastion of resistance is still holding out just north-east of the capital, Kabul.

item.title: Afghanistan: Qatar and Turkey become Taliban's lifeline to the outside world
item.description: Qatar and Turkey emerge as key channels between Afghanistan's new rulers and the outside world.

item.title: Inger Stoejberg: Danish ex-immigration minister faces impeachment trial
item.description: Inger Stoejberg is accused of unlawfully ordering the separation of young asylum-seeking couples.

item.title: Viewpoint: Algerian blame games expose deep political crisis
item.description: Algerians are clamouring for democratic reforms and the weakening the influence of the military.

item.title: Beaten and humiliated by Hindu mobs for being a Muslim in India
item.description: Attacks on Muslims by Hindu mobs have risen in India, with little apparent official condemnation.

item.title: Kabul make-up artist: 'Women like me are Taliban targets'
item.description: A make-up artist in hiding explains how much Afghanistan's beauty industry has meant to women.

item.title: New York City declares state of emergency after record rainfall
item.description: NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio said the city was "enduring an historic weather event".

item.title: Abba announce new album Voyage and virtual concerts in London
item.description: The Swedish group unveil their first new music in almost 40 years and shows in London from May 2022.

item.title: Dontae Sharpe: 'My 26-year fight to prove my innocence'
item.description: After two decades wrongfully behind bars, Dontae Sharpe is finally free but there's one more battle to fight.

item.title: Spain hit with severe flooding after storm
item.description: Homes in north and central Spain are left isolated and without electricity as roads are forced to close.

item.title: Paralympics: How hand-cycling saved my life
item.description: In preparation for the Paralympics, South Korean hand-cycling champion, Doyeon Lee has been riding more than 300km every week.

item.title: Afghanistan women's cricket team: Players hiding in Kabul fear Taliban rule
item.description: Members of Afghanistan's women's cricket team are hiding in Kabul, fearing for their safety following the Taliban's return to power.

item.title: Halo Trust resumes Afghanistan explosive clearance work
item.description: The Halo Trust, which has its HQ in Scotland, resumes its clearance operations under Taliban rule.

item.title: Afghanistan: British passport delay blamed for baby stranded in Kabul
item.description: "We want to hug her, kiss her", say her parents, who had to return to the UK to replace travel documents.

item.title: Female journalist who interviewed Taliban flees
item.description: Beheshta Arghand, who made headlines when she interviewed the Taliban, has spoken out after fleeing the country.

item.title: Afghanistan: Joe Biden speech on withdrawal fact-checked
item.description: How consistent is President Biden in his comments on Afghanistan following the final US troop withdrawal?
